Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Effects of Intravenous Anesthetics on Ischemia-Reperfusion Injury

Trial_Design.evidence: A randomised controlled trial was conducted with individual participants as the unit of randomisation. The sample size was determined based on anticipated effect sizes from prior research.

Participants.evidence: Participants were eligible if they were undergoing surgical procedures with potential IRI, and the study was completed in a hospital setting.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention involved administering intravenous anesthetics, while the control group received standard care.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the reduction in tissue injury, assessed over a 24-hour period post-intervention.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was achieved using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed with sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors, patients, and clinicians.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 200 participants were randomised: 100 to the intervention group and 100 to the control group, recruited between January 2020 and June 2021.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis included 98 participants in the intervention group and 97 in the control group, using an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The intervention group demonstrated a significant reduction in tissue injury (mean difference = 5.2, 95% CI 3.1 to 7.3; p = 0.01).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were mild, with 3% in the intervention group and 1% in the control group experiencing side effects.
